biography_text: YOUNG, Todd, a Senator and a Representative from Indiana; born in Lancaster, Lancaster County, Pa., August 24, 1972; graduated from Carmel High School, Carmel, Ind., 1990; B.S., United States Naval Academy, Annapolis, Md., 1995; M.B.A., University of Chicago, Chicago, Ill., 2000; M.A., University of London, London, England, 2001; J.D., Robert H. McKinney School of Law, Indiana University, Indianapolis, Ind., 2006; United States Navy, 1990-1991; United States Marine Corps, 1995-2000; staff, United States Senator Richard Lugar of Indiana, 2001-2003; Orange County, Ind., assistant deputy prosecutor, 2007-2010; consultant; lawyer, private practice; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Twelfth and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2011-January 3, 2017); was not a candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as a Republican to the United States Senate in 2016 for the term ending January 3, 2023.

post_secondary_degrees.institution: United States Naval Academy, Annapolis, Md.
Robert H. McKinney School of Law, Indiana University, Indianapolis, Ind.
